FindString

This component determines if the string input [In]s2 is contained in the string input [In]s1 when triggered by the input event. If the string input [In]s2 is contained in the string input [In]s1 then the portion of [In]s1 starting with [In]s2, to the end of [In]s1 is presented to the output [Out] and the output [Out] is set to "TRUE". Else if the string input [In]s2 is not contained in the string input [In]s1 then the output [Out] is set to "FALSE". Note the data at output [Out] is persistent. The find string is performed by the C function strstr(), please refer to the C documentation for more information.

Ports

  • [In] s1:

    Data input.

  • [In] s2:

    Data input.

  • [Out] :

    Data output, the input string [In]s1 starting at the point it matches the input string [In]s2.

  • [Out] :

    Data output, the result of the determination of whether the input string [In]s2 is contained in [In]s1.

  • [In] :

    Input event, compares the input string [In]s2 to [In]s1 when fired.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

Parameters

None.

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
